it.polimi.ingsw.LM26.controller.controllerHandler

Class EventChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.LM26.controller.controllerHandler.EventChecker

  • public class EventChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    EventChecker class
    Author:
    Eugenio Cortesi this class implements methods that checks if an action can be done, analyzing players and game situation.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • checkPlacement

        public boolean checkPlacement(DieInt dieFromDraft,
                              Box toBox,
                              PlayerZone player)
        method that checks if a die can be placed on the position chosen. if it's second attempt of placing from card 6 or 11, a control makes sure that client uses the same die chosen or assigned in the last attempt of placing. if a client already used his die the placement can't be done. if the placement is done, this method update the player history in this half round, model restrictions, and it takes away die from draft pool.
        Parameters:
        dieFromDraft - Die chosen by client from the draftPool
        toBox - Cell of the playerBoard, chosen by the client for the placement.
        player - client that sent the place die request
        Returns:
        true if a placement went well, otherwise false

      • checkActionAvailability

        public boolean checkActionAvailability(PlayerZone player,
                                       ToolCardInt card)
        this checks if the client has already use a card in his turn. If he has, but card is 11 this control is bypassed because this specific card needs more than one action.
        Parameters:
        player - client of the action
        card - card selected by client
        Returns:
        true, is controls are true

      • checkCard

        public boolean checkCard(int i)
        it controls if the card requested in the action event is one of the three selected
        Parameters:
        i - id of the card in the event
        Returns:
        true, if the card is one the selected ones

      • checkToken

        public boolean checkToken(PlayerZone player,
                          ToolCardInt toolCard,
                          java.lang.Boolean pay)
        this check-method is used two times: the first one to check is the player has enough token to use the card requested, the second one to put tokens on the card (pay)
        Parameters:
        player - client of the action
        toolCard - card requested: it can require one token if it's never user, otherwise two tokens.
        pay - boolean that says if this is the first usage type (just controlling) or the second (paying)
        Returns:
        true, if client has enough tokens and if the payment is done
